column4: hey guys, where can I get the latest 9.04 pre-release to test it and help developing?
http://www.ubuntu.com/testing/jaunty/alpha6
thx
Alternately, if you're running 8.10, update-manager -d in terminal will do it for you.
the ubuntu page is actually complicated
will I be able to boot both then?
Both?
8.04 and 9.04, will I be able to choose which one to boot?
If you update with update-manager, your current Ubuntu is upgraded to it.
If you install with the CD, you can make a new partition for 9.04 to keep 8.04.
I think it may be useful to keep the old version
Then download the CD and use it =P
jup, thx
btw, what is the most intelligent way to install a new iso without burning a cd?
It would be to burn the CD =P
Helpful to keep a CD in case you need it.
okay :D.. another question: could it be useful to use VMs to test 9.04 or would you suggest it on real hardware?
If you can VM it, just do that for now. It's only an Alpha release.
so you think that bugs in VMs will also be useful for real machines then
The issue is that an alpha release might have damaging bugs (as people report data loss with ext4 and such)
what about kvm?
I don't know, I'm not very experienced with VM's, sorry.
I'll try it out, thx
